intro: Axinaea glauca, commonly known as the blue axinaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly waxy texture. Axinaea glauca is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
